subject: Re: [junit] black box or white box?
msgSnippet: ... the ... the ... reached. I don t understand the second point. (Pause.) Wait, maybe I do. I use my knowledge of the current implementation that passes the
messageBody:
On 2002-05-02 at 22:49 Johannes Link wrote:

> So in a
>sense test-driven development is both:
>- It's specification-based (black-box) because you *should* only use
the
>public interface
>- It's implementation-based (white-box) because you must be aware of
the
>implementation to decide when a sufficient coverage level has been
reached.

I don't understand the second point. (Pause.) Wait, maybe I do. I use
my knowledge of the current implementation that passes the current
tests to decide what test to write next, if any. Is that what you mean?

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
